title: Alternator Cover - Removal

body.body: Warning - Alternator rotor magnets finger injury SM

The rotor magnets are very strong. When handling the alternator cover the magnets may 'grab' the stator, causing injury to the hands or fingers. When handling the alternator cover wear suitable gloves and only grip the alternator cover by the outside surfaces; always keep hands and fingers clear when handling the alternator cover.
The alternator and crankshaft position sensor share the same harness.
Note that the white tape on the harnesses within the harness guide aligns with the upper gap for installation.
Note the routing of the alternator harness for installation.
Alternator cover removal D34; DD2; DD4; DE; DE2; DEX; DF; DF2; DF4; DG4
Remove the lock nuts and detach the coolant expansion tank from its mounting. Discard the lock nuts.
Remove the fixings, detach the alternator harness and remove the coolant expansion tank mounting.
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the rear brake fluid reservoir from the relay bracket.

body.name: Detach rear brake fluid reservoir citi_1

body.body: Secure the rear brake fluid reservoir in an upright position.
Disconnect the crankshaft position sensor from the main harness.
Note the routing of the crankshaft position sensor harness and for installation.
Route the crankshaft position sensor harness through the frame to the harness guide on the crankcase.
Remove and discard the fixing and detach the harness guide from the crankcase.
Carefully remove the alternator harness from the harness guide.
Note the routing of the alternator harness and its clips for installation.
Route the alternator harness with the grey electrical connector to the alternator cover.
Place an oil catch tray beneath the alternator cover to collect any oil that may spill out on removal.
Release the fixings securing the alternator cover to the crankcases.
Carefully withdraw the alternator cover from the crankcase.
Remove the gasket and clean the surfaces of the crankcase and the alternator cover using a lint free cloth.
Remove and discard the O-rings from the balancer dead shaft.

body.name: Graphic from Alternator Cover - Removal  (civa (DNDP, Service Manual, Engine covers).svg)
